data: Count de St. Paul | Count de Ponthieu

Among all the great families which flourished in France in the reign of Philip the First, the Count de St. Paul and the Count de Ponthieu were the most distinguished; but especially the Count de Ponthieu, who, possessing a great extent of dominion, maintained the title of sovereign with inconceiveable magnificence.

The Princess of Ponthieu
(in) The New-York Weekly Magazine or Miscellaneous Repository
